translations: v.陪伴（chaperon 的 ing 形式）

sentences.sentence: Washing dishes just doesn't sound as good as chaperoning passengers on exotic excursions.
sentences.translation: 洗碗就不如陪同船上的旅客听起来体面。 。

sentences.sentence: Thus, before I knew it, mid-week had dissolved into the final night of camp and I was chaperoning the "last dance".
sentences.translation: 我还没明白过来，星期三已成过去，露营的最后一晚来到了。 我伴随营员们跳起“最后的舞蹈”。

sentences.sentence: A 17-year-old girl said she was kicked out of her prom because some of the dads chaperoning the event for home-schooled teens thought her dancing would give the boys "impure thoughts."
sentences.translation: 一名17岁的女孩说她被赶出自己的毕业舞会，因为一些陪同自主学习少年参加舞会的家长认为她的舞蹈会让那些少年产生“不纯洁的想法”。
